transcripts.text: Before I answer this question, please let me encourage you to do three things.  Subscribe to our channel, like us on social media, and consider joining us as a supporter at patreon.com.

The fish symbol actually means Jesus Christ, Son of God.  And what is happening there?  in the Greek, it's taking the first letter of each of those words, Jesus Christ, Son of God.  So Christos, you have the first letter of that.  And so it meets out to mean Jesus Christ, Son of God.  And so it's a term or a label that... was one that unified the early Christians together.  In fact, in the Roman catacombs, the early church that was being persecuted would come together and they would inscribe the fish in those catacombs.  And it was basically a symbol of this place is a safe entry for you, Christian.  Come in here.  We too believe in Jesus Christ, the son of God.
